places.name: Pune Airport (Lohegaon Airport)
places.description: Pune Airport, officially known as Pune International Airport, is located in Lohegaon, about 10 km northeast of Pune city center. It serves as a major gateway to the city and handles both domestic and international flights. The airport has been modernized in recent years and features state-of-the-art facilities.
keyFacts: Originally built during British colonial era for military purposes
Handles over 7 million passengers annually
Has both domestic and international terminals
Second busiest airport in Maharashtra after Mumbai

quiz.question: In which year was Pune Airport originally established?
quiz.explanation: Pune Airport was originally established in 1939 during the British colonial period for military purposes.

quiz.question: What is the official name of Pune Airport?
quiz.explanation: The official name is Pune International Airport, though it's commonly referred to as Lohegaon Airport.

quiz.question: Approximately how far is Pune Airport from the city center?
quiz.explanation: Pune Airport is located about 10 kilometers northeast of Pune city center.

quiz.question: Which state is Pune Airport the second busiest in?
quiz.explanation: Pune Airport is the second busiest airport in Maharashtra, after Mumbai.

quiz.question: What type of flights does Pune Airport handle?
quiz.explanation: Pune Airport handles both domestic and international passenger flights.

places.name: Pune General Post Office
places.description: The Pune General Post Office (GPO) is a historic postal facility located in the heart of Pune city. It serves as the main postal hub for the region and is an important landmark. The building showcases colonial architecture and has been serving the postal needs of Pune residents for decades.
keyFacts: One of the oldest post offices in Western India
Features beautiful colonial architecture
Handles over 10,000 postal transactions daily
Serves as regional postal headquarters

quiz.question: In which area of Pune is the General Post Office located?
quiz.explanation: The Pune General Post Office is located in Sadashiv Peth area.

quiz.question: When was the Pune General Post Office established?
quiz.explanation: The Pune General Post Office was established in 1858 during the British colonial period.

quiz.question: What architectural style does the GPO building represent?
quiz.explanation: The GPO building showcases colonial architecture from the British era.

quiz.question: Approximately how many postal transactions does the GPO handle daily?
quiz.explanation: The Pune GPO handles over 10,000 postal transactions daily.

quiz.question: What is the significance of Pune GPO in the region?
quiz.explanation: The Pune GPO serves as the regional postal headquarters for the area.

places.name: Pune Municipal Corporation Office
places.description: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) headquarters is the main administrative center for Pune city's civic governance. Located in the heart of the city, this building houses various departments responsible for city planning, infrastructure, water supply, waste management, and other municipal services.
keyFacts: Governs an area of over 500 square kilometers
Serves a population of over 3 million people
Handles city planning and development
Manages water supply and waste management for the city

quiz.question: What does PMC stand for?
quiz.explanation: PMC stands for Pune Municipal Corporation, the civic body governing Pune city.

quiz.question: In which area is the PMC headquarters located?
quiz.explanation: The PMC headquarters is located in Shivajinagar area of Pune.

quiz.question: Approximately what population does PMC serve?
quiz.explanation: The Pune Municipal Corporation serves a population of over 3 million people.

quiz.question: What area does PMC govern?
quiz.explanation: PMC governs an area of over 500 square kilometers.

quiz.question: When was the PMC established in its current form?
quiz.explanation: The Pune Municipal Corporation was established in its current form in 1950.

places.name: Shaniwar Wada
places.description: Shaniwar Wada is a historic palace and fort built by the Peshwas of the Maratha Empire. Located in the heart of Pune, it served as the seat of power for the Peshwa rulers. Though much of the original structure was destroyed in a fire, the remaining walls and gates showcase the grandeur of Maratha architecture.
keyFacts: Built by Peshwa Baji Rao I in 1732
Served as the administrative headquarters of the Maratha Empire
Famous for its grand gates and impressive fortification
Site of the mysterious death of young Peshwa Narayanrao

quiz.question: Who built Shaniwar Wada?
quiz.explanation: Shaniwar Wada was built by Peshwa Baji Rao I in 1732.

quiz.question: In which year was Shaniwar Wada built?
quiz.explanation: Shaniwar Wada was built in 1732 by Peshwa Baji Rao I.

quiz.question: What was Shaniwar Wada primarily used for?
quiz.explanation: Shaniwar Wada served as the administrative headquarters of the Maratha Empire.

quiz.question: Which empire did Shaniwar Wada serve as the seat of power for?
quiz.explanation: Shaniwar Wada served as the seat of power for the Maratha Empire under the Peshwas.

quiz.question: What happened to much of the original Shaniwar Wada structure?
quiz.explanation: Much of the original Shaniwar Wada structure was destroyed in a fire, leaving mainly the walls and gates.

places.name: Aga Khan Palace
places.description: Aga Khan Palace is a magnificent monument built by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III in 1892. This historic palace is famous for being the prison where Mahatma Gandhi, his wife Kasturba Gandhi, and other freedom fighters were held during the Quit India Movement. Today, it serves as a memorial to Gandhi and houses a museum.
places.address: Aga Khan Palace Road, Yerwada, Pune, Maharashtra 411006
keyFacts: Built by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III
Served as prison for Mahatma Gandhi during Quit India Movement
Site where Kasturba Gandhi and Mahadev Desai died
Now serves as a Gandhi Memorial and Museum

quiz.question: Who built the Aga Khan Palace?
options: Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III
quiz.explanation: Aga Khan Palace was built by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III in 1892.

quiz.question: When was Aga Khan Palace built?
quiz.explanation: The Aga Khan Palace was built in 1892.

quiz.question: During which movement was Gandhi imprisoned at Aga Khan Palace?
quiz.explanation: Gandhi was imprisoned at Aga Khan Palace during the Quit India Movement in 1942.

quiz.question: Who died at Aga Khan Palace during Gandhi's imprisonment?
options: Both Kasturba Gandhi and Mahadev Desai
quiz.explanation: Both Kasturba Gandhi (Gandhi's wife) and Mahadev Desai (Gandhi's secretary) died at Aga Khan Palace during their imprisonment.

quiz.question: What is Aga Khan Palace used for today?
quiz.explanation: Today, Aga Khan Palace serves as a Gandhi Memorial and Museum, commemorating the freedom struggle.

places.name: Sinhagad Fort
places.description: Sinhagad Fort is a historic hill fortress located about 30 km southwest of Pune. Originally called Kondana, it was renamed Sinhagad (Lion's Fort) after the heroic Maratha warrior Tanaji Malusare died while capturing it from the Mughals. The fort offers stunning views of the surrounding countryside and is a popular trekking destination.
keyFacts: Originally known as Kondana Fort
Scene of the famous battle where Tanaji Malusare died
Offers panoramic views of Pune and surrounding areas
Popular trekking and tourist destination

quiz.question: What was the original name of Sinhagad Fort?
quiz.explanation: Sinhagad Fort was originally called Kondana, before being renamed after Tanaji Malusare's heroic battle.

quiz.question: Who was the Maratha warrior associated with Sinhagad Fort?
quiz.explanation: Tanaji Malusare was the heroic Maratha warrior who died while capturing Sinhagad from the Mughals.

quiz.question: What does 'Sinhagad' mean?
quiz.explanation: Sinhagad means 'Lion's Fort', named in honor of the lion-hearted Tanaji Malusare.

quiz.question: Approximately how far is Sinhagad Fort from Pune?
quiz.explanation: Sinhagad Fort is located about 30 kilometers southwest of Pune.

quiz.question: When was Sinhagad Fort originally established?
quiz.explanation: Sinhagad Fort was originally established in the 2nd Century BCE, making it over 2000 years old.

places.name: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay)
places.description: IIT Bombay is one of India's premier technological institutes and among the most prestigious engineering colleges in the country. Located in Powai, Mumbai, it has strong connections with Pune through research collaborations and many alumni. Though not physically in Pune, it's relevant due to the significant student and professional connections.
keyFacts: One of the original five IITs established in India
Consistently ranked among top engineering institutes globally
Strong alumni network including many CEOs and entrepreneurs
Collaborates with Pune-based industries and research institutions

quiz.explanation: IIT Bombay was established in 1958 as one of the original five IITs in India.

quiz.explanation: IIT Bombay is located in Powai, Mumbai, Maharashtra.

quiz.explanation: IIT Bombay was one of the original five IITs established in India.

quiz.explanation: IIT Bombay is primarily known for engineering and technology education and research.

quiz.question: What is notable about IIT Bombay's alumni?
quiz.explanation: IIT Bombay has a strong alumni network including many successful CEOs, entrepreneurs, and industry leaders.

places.name: College of Engineering Pune (COEP)
places.description: College of Engineering Pune (COEP) is one of India's oldest and most prestigious engineering institutions. Established in 1854, it has a rich legacy of producing distinguished engineers and technologists. Located on the banks of the Mula river, the college has historic buildings and has contributed significantly to India's industrial development.

Established during British rule in 1854
Located on the scenic banks of Mula river
Alumni include prominent industrialists and engineers

quiz.explanation: COEP is located on the scenic banks of the Mula river in Pune.

quiz.question: In which area of Pune is COEP located?
quiz.explanation: COEP is located in the Shivajinagar area of Pune.

quiz.question: During whose rule was COEP established?
quiz.explanation: COEP was established in 1854 during British colonial rule in India.

places.name: Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC)
places.description: Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) is a premier medical institution in Pune that trains medical officers for the Indian Armed Forces. Established in 1962, it is known for its excellent medical education, state-of-the-art facilities, and discipline. The college has produced many distinguished military doctors and medical researchers.

Known for discipline and excellent medical training
Produces medical officers for Army, Navy, and Air Force

quiz.question: Which branches of armed forces does AFMC train doctors for?
quiz.explanation: AFMC trains medical officers for all three branches: Army, Navy, and Air Force.

quiz.explanation: AFMC is located in Wanowrie area of Pune.

quiz.explanation: AFMC is particularly known for its discipline and excellent medical training.

places.name: Pune University (Savitribai Phule Pune University)
places.description: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU), formerly known as University of Pune, is a premier public research university. Established in 1949, it has a sprawling campus and is one of India's largest universities by student enrollment. The university is named after Savitribai Phule, a pioneer in women's education.

Named after Savitribai Phule, pioneer of women's education
One of India's largest universities by enrollment

places.name: Osho Ashram (Osho International Meditation Resort)

places.name: Dagdusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple
places.description: Dagdusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple is one of the most famous and richest temples in Pune. Built in 1893 by sweet merchant Dagdusheth Halwai after losing his son to plague, this temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The temple is especially famous during Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations and attracts millions of devotees.

One of the richest temples in Pune
Famous for elaborate Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations
Attracts millions of devotees annually

places.name: Chaturshringi Temple
places.description: Chaturshringi Temple is an ancient temple dedicated to Goddess Chaturshringi, located on a hill in Pune. The temple is believed to be over 1,400 years old and is one of the most important spiritual centers in Pune. The temple offers panoramic views of the city and is especially crowded during Navratri.

Dedicated to Goddess Chaturshringi

quiz.question: In which century was the temple established?
quiz.explanation: The Chaturshringi Temple was established in the 6th Century CE.

places.name: Parvati Hill Temple
places.description: Parvati Hill is one of the most prominent hills in Pune, located in the heart of the city. The hill houses the famous Parvati Temple dedicated to Goddess Parvati. places.name: Fergusson College
places.description: Fergusson College is one of Pune's most prestigious educational institutions, established in 1885. Named after Sir James Fergusson, the Governor of Bombay, the college is affiliated with the University of Pune and is known for its excellent academic programs in arts, science, and commerce. places.name: Pune Station (Pune Junction Railway Station)
places.description: Pune Junction Railway Station is the main railway station serving Pune city and is one of the busiest railway stations in Maharashtra. Built during the British era, it serves as a major transportation hub connecting Pune to various cities across India. The station handles both passenger and freight traffic and is an important junction on the Central Railway network.
